math3d

Class Triangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • math3d.Triangle
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Polygon

    public class Triangle
extends java.lang.Object
implements Polygon
    A Polygon with 3 vertices. All 3 vertices shouldn't be collinear.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface math3d.Polygon

        Polygon.PolygonType, Polygon.Vertex, Polygon.VertexOrder

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(Vector3 v1,
                Vector3 v2,
                Vector3 v3,
                Polygon.VertexOrder order)
        Create a triangle from 3 vectors. Vertices will be generated from the vectors, with the same normal as the triangle itself.
        Parameters:
        v1 - the first vector
        v2 - the second vector
        v3 - the third vector
        order - the order of the vertices

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(double v1x,
                double v1y,
                double v1z,
                double v2x,
                double v2y,
                double v2z,
                double v3x,
                double v3y,
                double v3z,
                Polygon.VertexOrder order)
        Create a triangle from the coordinates of 3 vectors. Vertices will be generated from the vectors, with the same normal as the triangle itself.
        Parameters:
        v1x - the x value of the first vector
        v1y - the y value of the first vector
        v1z - the z value of the first vector
        v2x - the x value of the second vector
        v2y - etc.
        v2z -
        v3x -
        v3y -
        v3z -
        order - the order of the vertices

      • Triangle

        public Triangle(double[] v,
                Polygon.VertexOrder order)
        Create a triangle from an array of 9 values representing 3 vectors. Vertices will be generated from the vectors, with the same normal as the triangle itself
        Parameters:
        v - an array of 3 groups of x-y-z triples
        order - the order of the vertices
